jparsec.model

Class RADEX

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.model.RADEX

  • public class RADEX
extends java.lang.Object
    RADEX program, adequate to calculate the strengths of atomic and molecular lines from interstellar clouds, which are assumed to be homogeneous. The use of this class is subject to reference to the original paper: Van der Tak, F.F.S., Black, J.H., Schöier, F.L., Jansen, D.J., van Dishoeck, E.F., 2007, A&A 468, 627-635.

    This Java version corresponds to the translation of the original Fortran program version from August 29, 2007, updated to 30nov2011 version on April 4, 2012.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      • method

        public RADEX.METHOD method
        ID constant for the method (geometry) to apply.

      • jpl

        public boolean jpl
        True to use JPL catalog to solve transitions, false for COLOGNE. JPL usually includes the hyperfine transitions (OH, HCL, N2H+, and HCN), and COLOGNE contains them at once (added). OH and HCL are not supported even in this way in COLOGNE.

      • MOLECULE_ATOM_NAMES

    • Constructor Detail

      • RADEX

        public RADEX(int molID,
     double columnDensity,
     double lineWidth,
     double Tkin,
     double Tbg,
     double minFreq,
     double maxFreq,
     RADEX.PARTNER[] partnerID,
     double[] partnerDensity,
     RADEX.METHOD method,
     boolean jpl)
      throws JPARSECException
        Full constructor. This constructor also checks the input data, and, if everything is OK, the calculation of line intensities are performed. Minimum and maximum frequencies can define a range to return the intensities for a given set of transitions, or can be the same value to specify exactly one and only that transition.
        Parameters:
        molID - Molecule ID.
        columnDensity - Column density.
        lineWidth - Line width in km/s.
        Tkin - Kinetic temperature.
        Tbg - Background temperature.
        minFreq - Minimum frequency (GHz).
        maxFreq - Maximum frequency (GHz).
        partnerID - IDs for the partners.
        partnerDensity - Densities for the partners.
        method - Geometry to apply.
        jpl - True to use JPL catalog to solve transitions, false for COLOGNE. JPL usually includes the hyperfine transitions (OH, HCL, N2H+, and HCN), and COLOGNE contains them at once (added). OH and HCL are not supported even in this way in COLOGNE.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • RADEX

        public RADEX(int molID,
     double columnDensity,
     double lineWidth,
     double Tkin,
     double Tbg,
     double minFreq,
     double maxFreq,
     RADEX.PARTNER partnerID,
     double partnerDensity,
     RADEX.METHOD method,
     boolean jpl)
      throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for one collisional partner. This constructor also checks the input data, and, if everything is OK, the calculation of line intensities are performed. Minimum and maximum frequencies can define a range to return the intensities for a given set of transitions, or can be the same value to specify exactly one and only that transition.
        Parameters:
        molID - Molecule ID.
        columnDensity - Column density.
        lineWidth - Line width in km/s.
        Tkin - Kinetic temperature.
        Tbg - Background temperature.
        minFreq - Minimum frequency (GHz).
        maxFreq - Maximum frequency (GHz).
        partnerID - ID for the partner.
        partnerDensity - Densities for the partners.
        method - Geometry to apply.
        jpl - True to use JPL catalog to solve transitions, false for COLOGNE. JPL usually includes the hyperfine transitions (OH, HCL, N2H+, and HCN), and COLOGNE contains them at once (added). OH and HCL are not supported even in this way in COLOGNE.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMoleculeRadexID

        public static int getMoleculeRadexID(java.lang.String molecule,
                     boolean jpl,
                     double freq)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Return the integer identifier for a given molecule in RADEX, considering possible orto and para cases.
        Parameters:
        molecule - The molecule name, as given in the JPL or COLOGNE databases, and contained in arrays in this class (MOLECULE_ATOM_NAMES_CORRESPONDENCE_JPL_CATALOG and MOLECULE_ATOM_NAMES_CORRESPONDENCE_COLOGNE_CATALOG).
        jpl - True for JPL, false for COLOGNE.
        freq - The frequency in GHz of the line you are interested.
        Returns:
        The integer identifier.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • update

        public void update()
            throws JPARSECException
        Updates calculations in case some values of the instance were modified by hand.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
